results.title: Helen's war: Portrait of a dissident
results.creator_credit: AFFC, Sonja Armstrong Productions, Reel to Reel Productions, Sonja Armstrong, Anne Pick and Anna Broinowski
results.brief_description: A moving documentary about one woman’s anti-nuclear crusade that has her challenging the very fabric of American society - but she’s an Australian. A qualified medical doctor, Helen Caldicott has been a peace activist for the last twenty years. Her cynical filmmaking niece, Anna Broinowski, goes on the road with her aunt for a year to document and sometimes challenge Dr Caldicott. Helen’s predictions of the use of missiles on the people of Iraq become true and she is more determined to fight the good fight, particularly post 9/11. Her public speaking is something to behold and the reactions she receives, either enraging people or moving them to empathetic tears is powerful stuff. An Australian/Canadian co-production.

results.title: Heki-un-so and Kyoto
results.brief_description: A visit to the ancient city of Kyoto which is the cradle of ten centureis of history and tradition. Shows the beautiful Heki-un-so gardens, created in the traditional Japanese style, during the four seasons of the year, as well as many examples of ancient and modern Japanese buildings, a tea ceremony and many ceremonies and festivals which are part of the way of life in this ancient capital city of Japan.

results.title: Heidi Di Santo's guide to relaxation
results.brief_description: Heidi Di Santo teaches a relaxation technique to assist with combating stress in the workplace. Stress is something which affects the productivity of most workplaces, and this video offers suggestions on how to minimize the stress and increase productivity.

results.title: Heidi
results.brief_description: Heidi, a high spirited Swiss orphan, is taken to live with her grandfather in the Swiss Alps where she lives in harmony with her surroundings and becomes friends with Peter, a young goatherd. Her Aunt arrives unexpectedly and forces her to leave the mountains and the grandfather she adores. She is taken to live with a city family and although she becomes close to Clara, her young companion who is doomed to spend her life in a wheelchair, Heidi is terribly homesick and wonders if she will ever return to the mountains to see her grandfather again.

results.title: Hector goes to play ball
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Parker, Crawford Productions and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: A fantasy which employs fun-loving Hector the Cat to teach children road safety rules. Hector is a giant cat who lives in the botanical gardens and loves to play with the children who visit him there. He leads them in an assortment of colourful games, but comes to a bad end because he forgets his road safety rules.

results.title: Hector and Milly save Uncle Tom
results.brief_description: Hector has just married Milly, and before they drive off, he checks his bride’s safety belt. Their first house guest is Uncle Tom, a silly old man lacking all road sense. It takes all Hector and Milly’s time saving him from trouble. Words and music by Charles Marawood, Damien Parer - Unit Manager. Costumed characters performed in pantomime musical style.

results.title: Heavy horse pull
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Beryl Fox, Don Hopkins, Ronald Squire and Roberta King
results.brief_description: A humorous documentary about horse-pulling contests in Ontario and the people who prepare for them, this film tackles heavy loads with a light touch. It travels from the farm to the contest, where excitement runs high and the quips do not lack in local colour. Photographed by Robert Fresco.

results.title: Heaven's My Destination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyman”.
Since returning from the moon many astronauts have testified to the strong spiritual impact the space experience has had on them. A number have committed themselves to Christ and Ed Mitchell has founded the Institute of Noetic Sciences. This program looks at how space travel has given these men a new perception of man’s place in the universe.

results.title: Heathlands
results.brief_description: The first section studies the geology of the dry, sandy heathlands typical of south-eastern England and part of northern France. The second section introduces flora typical of the uncultivated heathlands and the final section deals with the fauna of the heathlands.
